Class Physics

  • java.lang.Object
    • Physics

  • public class Physics
extends java.lang.Object
    This class control the movement and collision of the given ball object. The ball can either collide with "sides", bricks or a moving pad, and should it collide with any it would bounce away. No gravity is taken into consideration with a bounce.
    Version:
    2013-05-14
    Author:
    Jonathan Olergård, Jack Shabo

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Physics(java.util.ArrayList<Item> items, java.util.ArrayList<Powerup> powerups)
      Constructor for class Physics which specify items to use for movement and collisions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Physics

        public Physics(java.util.ArrayList<Item> items,
       java.util.ArrayList<Powerup> powerups)
        Constructor for class Physics which specify items to use for movement and collisions.
        Parameters:
        items - The items to use for calculations.

    • Method Detail

      • newGame

        public void newGame()

      • hasLost

        public boolean hasLost()
        Checks if the ball moved below the pad. If so, return true (indicating that the game has been lost).
        Returns:
        boolean true if the Game has been lost, false otherwise.

      • sticky

        public boolean sticky()
        Looks whether a pad is sticky and if the ball has collided with the pad.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the conditions meet, false otherwise.

      • moveBall

        public void moveBall()
        Method used to move the ball object. Calculations and checks are made in order to determine the ball's speed. Then, the ball is moved to a new X and Y coordinate.

      • movePowerups

        public void movePowerups(Game game)
        Moves the spawned Powerup's, if any. Also, checks whether the Powerup collide with the pad. If so, activate the Powerup.

      • followPad

        public void followPad()
        Makes the ball follow the pad.

      • movePad

        public void movePad(java.lang.String direction)
        Move the pad.
        Parameters:
        direction - A string representing the direction to move. Will move right if the string matches "right", ignoring case, and left if it matches "left", ignoring case.
